alert.note: Alert for Fresno (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 1:08PM PST until January 10 at 12:20PM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Fresno County, including areas south of highway 168 near Shaver lake and the community of Tollhouse. * WHEN...Until 430 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 108 PM PST, Doppler radar indicated an area of very heavy rainfall across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Trimmer Springs, Mountain Rest, Shaver Lake, Shaver Lake 3ne and Auberry. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
